sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: (HGTY) Price Dynamics and Execution-Aware Positioning
feed.summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of Hagerty Inc. Class A (NASDAQ: HGTY) stock, highlighting a neutral near and mid-term outlook with a positive long-term bias. It outlines institutional trading strategies, including long, momentum breakout, and short positions, along with multi-timeframe signal analysis indicating support and resistance levels. The analysis also emphasizes an exceptional risk-reward short setup targeting a 9.0% downside.

feed.title: How Investors May Respond To Hagerty (HGTY) Broad Arrow’s Surging Private Sales And Global Expansion
feed.summary: Hagerty's subsidiary, Broad Arrow, saw over US$624 million in transactions in 2025, driven by significant growth in private sales and global expansion. This success strengthens Hagerty's non-insurance revenue stream but also exposes the company to risks if classic car demand cools or international investments fail. Investors need to consider these dynamics against Hagerty's raised 2025 guidance and diverse fair value estimates for the stock.

feed.title: BROAD ARROW EXCEEDS $624 MILLION IN TOTAL TRANSACTIONS ACROSS AUCTIONS, PRIVATE SALES, AND FINANCING IN 2025
feed.summary: Broad Arrow, a Hagerty company, announced a record-breaking 2025 with over $624 million in total transactions across auctions, private sales, and financing, marking a 97% year-over-year growth. The company sold 949 lots at auction for $257 million, facilitated 190 private transactions for over $281 million, and underwrote $85 million in new financing. Broad Arrow also expanded its auction footprint with new sales in Europe and the U.S., achieving significant success and setting multiple world record auction prices.

feed.title: Does Hagerty (NYSE:HGTY) Deserve A Spot On Your Watchlist?
feed.summary: Hagerty (NYSE:HGTY) shows promising signs for investors with growing revenues and profits, and a significant increase in earnings per share. Insiders hold a substantial stake, aligning their interests with shareholders, and CEO compensation is modest compared to peers, suggesting a solid investment opportunity. The company's financial health, insider confidence, and reasonable leadership remuneration make it a stock to watch.

feed.title: (HGTY) as a Liquidity Pulse for Institutional Tactics
feed.summary: Hagerty Inc. Class A (NASDAQ: HGTY) shows weak near and mid-term sentiment but a strong long-term outlook. AI models identify a 31.5:1 risk-reward setup targeting a 10.4% gain, with specific strategies provided for position trading, momentum breakout, and risk hedging. The analysis highlights an oscillation pattern and key support/resistance levels across different time horizons.

feed.title: Buy It Now, Thank Us Later: Hagerty's 2026 Bull Market List of 11 Appreciation-Ready Enthusiast Cars
feed.summary: Hagerty, Inc. has released its 2026 Bull Market List, featuring 11 enthusiast vehicles anticipated to increase in value. The list highlights a mix of modern and classic cars, emphasizing late 90s and 2000s models that represent the "analog era," alongside iconic classics with emerging buying opportunities. The selections are based on value, ownership cost, and enjoyment, covering a wide range of price points.

feed.title: Hagerty's 2026 Bull Market List of Appreciation-Ready Enthusiast Cars | THE SHOP
feed.summary: Hagerty Inc. has released its ninth annual Bull Market List for 2026, highlighting 11 enthusiast vehicles anticipated to increase in value next year. The list spans a wide range of price points and includes modern classics from the '90s and '00s, as well as iconic older models. Hagerty utilized extensive data analysis to identify cars that offer good value, low ownership costs, and significant driving enjoyment.

feed.title: RESPECTED PRIVATE COLLECTIONS LEAD EARLY HIGHLIGHTS FOR BROAD ARROW’S 2026 AMELIA AUCTION
feed.summary: Broad Arrow Auctions, a Hagerty company, has announced two significant private collections—The Bill Spurling Collection and The Wellington Morton Collection—as early highlights for its 2026 Amelia Auction. These collections, featuring exceptional pre-war and post-war American classics and diverse European, British, and American collector cars, will be offered without reserve. The auction, scheduled for March 6-7, 2026, will showcase approximately 150 collector cars and marks Broad Arrow’s fourth year as the official auction house of the Amelia Concours d’Elegance.

feed.title: Hagerty Inc’s Earnings Call: Strong Growth Amid Challenges
feed.summary: Hagerty Inc. (HGTY) reported strong Q3 financial results with an 18% increase in total revenue and a 240% surge in operating profit, driven by new partnerships and marketplace expansion. Despite challenges like rising expenses and lower "attach rates" for State Farm policies, the company raised its full-year revenue and adjusted EBITDA outlook. Hagerty remains optimistic, aiming to double its policies in force to 3 million by 2030.

feed.title: Hagerty Inc Reports Strong November 2025 Performance
feed.summary: Hagerty Inc Class A reported a successful November 2025 with a combined ratio under 90%, 18% revenue growth, and a 73% net income growth, driven by strategic initiatives and partnerships. Despite solid financial performance, analyst Spark rates HGTY stock as Neutral due to cash flow concerns and potential overvaluation. The company specializes in insurance for collectible vehicles.

feed.title: Hagerty Inc Reports Strong November 2025 Performance
feed.summary: Hagerty Inc (HGTY) reported a strong November 2025 performance, showcasing a combined ratio under 90%, 18% revenue growth, and a 73% net income growth. The company attributes its success to strategic initiatives like the Guardian Safe Storage Concierge program and partnerships with State Farm and Safeco. While financial performance is solid, TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, rates HGTY as Neutral due to cash flow concerns and potential overvaluation.

feed.title: A Look at Hagerty’s (HGTY) Valuation Following Upbeat Earnings, Raised Guidance, and New Liberty Mutual Partnership
feed.summary: Hagerty (HGTY) recently reported strong Q3 and year-to-date earnings, leading to raised full-year guidance and a new partnership with Liberty Mutual. This positive news has driven a 39% year-to-date share price increase, with investors optimistic about the company's long-term potential. While the narrative suggests the stock is fairly valued around $13.29, a DCF model indicates potential overvaluation if aggressive growth targets aren't met, highlighting the debate on whether the recent rally is fully priced in.

feed.title: BMO Capital Reaffirms Their Hold Rating on Hagerty Inc Class A (HGTY)
feed.summary: BMO Capital analyst Michael Zaremski has maintained a Hold rating on Hagerty Inc Class A (HGTY) with a price target of $15.00, despite the company reporting strong Q3 2025 revenues of $379.99 million and a net profit of $20.85 million. The average analyst consensus suggests a Moderate Buy, while corporate insider sentiment is negative due to increased selling activity.

feed.title: A Fresh Look at Hagerty (HGTY) Valuation Following Strong Earnings, Upgraded Guidance, and Liberty Mutual Partnership
feed.summary: Hagerty (HGTY) has garnered investor attention after reporting robust third-quarter earnings, raising its full-year guidance, and forging a new partnership with Liberty Mutual to expand its collectible car insurance reach. Despite a recent share price rally, a prominent valuation narrative suggests the company is still undervalued with a fair value of $13.29, driven by ambitious growth assumptions, impressive margin forecasts, and future earnings targets, particularly with the ramping State Farm partnership. However, its current P/E ratio of 27.3x is higher than the US Insurance industry average, presenting conflicting signals about its valuation amidst its growth potential and market expectations.

feed.title: Hagerty, Inc. SEC 10-Q Report
feed.summary: Hagerty, Inc. has released its latest Form 10-Q report, detailing significant growth in revenue and profitability, with total revenue reaching $379.994 million and net income at $46.171 million. The report also highlights strategic initiatives like the launch of Enthusiast+, a new insurance product for modern enthusiast vehicles, which is planned for a nationwide rollout. These developments indicate strong financial performance and a focused strategy for market expansion.

feed.title: Certain Restricted Stock Units of Hagerty, Inc. are subject to a Lock-Up Agreement Ending on 6-NOV-2025.
feed.summary: Hagerty, Inc. has certain Restricted Stock Units subject to a lock-up agreement that concludes on November 6, 2025. This lock-up period began on August 7, 2025, and restricts directors, executive officers, selling stockholders, Markel, and State Farm from selling or transferring capital stock or related securities without underwriter consent.

feed.title: Hagerty (HGTY) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Hagerty (NYSE: HGTY) reported strong Q3 2025 results, with total revenue up 18% and net income soaring 143% to $46 million. The company's enhanced full-year 2025 outlook anticipates 14%-15% revenue growth and net income between $124 million and $129 million, driven by accelerating State Farm policy conversions and strategic partnerships. Hagerty is also transitioning to a new fronting arrangement with Markel in 2026, which will give them 100% control over underwriting risk and premium.

feed.title: Collector car owners get boost with Hagerty–Liberty Mutual tie-up
feed.summary: Hagerty, Inc. has partnered with Liberty Mutual Insurance, enabling Liberty Mutual and its subsidiary Safeco to offer Hagerty's collector car coverage starting in 2026. This collaboration will broaden access to Hagerty's insurance solutions through Liberty Mutual's extensive distribution network, especially via independent insurance agents. The initiative aims to strengthen Liberty Mutual's niche offerings and provide Hagerty with wider distribution within the high-net-worth auto market.

feed.title: Hagerty Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results; Increases 2025 Outlook
feed.summary: Hagerty, Inc. (NYSE: HGTY) reported strong third-quarter 2025 financial results, with total revenue increasing 18% to $380.0 million and net income jumping 143% to $46.2 million. The company also raised its full-year 2025 outlook for total revenue growth to 14-15% and net income growth to 58-65%, demonstrating significant margin expansion and continued business momentum. Additionally, Hagerty announced a new partnership with Liberty Mutual, further expanding its strategic relationships.

feed.title: Why (HGTY) Price Action Is Critical for Tactical Trading
authors: netline - Contributor Editor: Thomas H. Kee Jr.
feed.summary: Stock Traders Daily's AI analysis for Hagerty Inc. Class A (NASDAQ: HGTY) suggests a neutral sentiment, favoring a wait-and-see approach due to a mid-channel oscillation pattern. The report outlines three distinct trading strategies (Position Trading, Momentum Breakout, Risk Hedging) with specific entry, target, and stop-loss levels. Multi-timeframe signal analysis consistently indicates a neutral stance across near-term, mid-term, and long-term horizons for HGTY.

feed.title: Hagerty Insider Sold Shares Worth $1,097,881, According to a Recent SEC Filing - MarketScreener
feed.summary: An insider at Hagerty, Inc. sold shares worth $1,097,881, as disclosed in a recent SEC filing. This transaction follows several other insider share sales from the company, indicating ongoing internal trading activity. Hagerty, Inc. (HGTY) specializes in automotive enthusiast brand services and classic vehicle insurance.

feed.title: HGTY Form 4: director sales disclosed; 987,742 shares remain indirect - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Hagerty, Inc. (HGTY) reported insider sales by a director under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. The director, Robert I. Kauffman, sold a total of 91,307 Class A common stock shares over three days in October 2025 at weighted average prices between $11.64 and $12.16. Following these transactions, 987,742 shares remain indirectly beneficially owned by Aldel LLC, where the reporting person is the manager.

feed.title: HGTY Form 144 filed for 23,392-share sale on NYSE via Merrill Lynch - Stock Titan
feed.summary: Robert I. Kauffman/Aldel LLC filed a Form 144 to sell 23,392 shares of Hagerty, Inc. common stock, valued at $272,283, with an approximate sale date of October 16, 2025, through Merrill Lynch on the NYSE. The shares were acquired through a PIPE financing during Hagerty's business combination in December 2021. The filing also details prior sales made by Robert I. Kauffman/Aldel LLC, including 12,391 shares on October 15, 2025, for $150,426 and 110,600 shares on July 24, 2025, for $1,156,876.

feed.title: Broad Arrow Auctions Achieves €26 Million in Sales at Inaugural Zoute Concours Auction - Quiver Quantitative
feed.summary: Broad Arrow Auctions generated €26.3 million in sales at its inaugural Zoute Concours Auction in Belgium, selling 78% of lots including a 1967 Ferrari 275 GTB/4 for over €3 million and a Lamborghini Pregunta concept for over €2.1 million. The event attracted 445 registered bidders and follows other successful auctions for the company, with upcoming events scheduled for Zürich and Las Vegas. The article also provides detailed insider trading activity, hedge fund activity, and analyst ratings/price targets for Broad Arrow's parent company, Hagerty (HGTY).

feed.title: Hagerty, Inc. Experiences Revision in Stock Evaluation Amid Positive Market Indicators - Markets Mojo
feed.summary: Hagerty, Inc., an insurance company, has had its stock evaluation revised, reflecting current market dynamics. The stock is currently trading at $12.09 and has shown significant returns year-to-date, outperforming the S&P 500. Technical indicators largely suggest a positive outlook, with some signs of volatility.

feed.title: JP Morgan Maintains Hagerty (HGTY) Neutral Recommendation
feed.summary: JP Morgan has maintained a Neutral recommendation for Hagerty (HGTY). Analysts project a 19.10% upside from its current price, with an average one-year price target of $14.28 per share. Institutional ownership in Hagerty has increased, with several key funds holding significant stakes.

feed.title: Hagerty stock rating reiterated at Equal Weight by Wells Fargo
feed.summary: Wells Fargo has reiterated its Equal Weight rating on Hagerty Inc. (NYSE:HGTY) with a $13.00 price target, noting the company's premium valuation at a P/E ratio of 60x. This comes despite Hagerty reporting mixed Q2 2025 earnings, with an EPS of $0.09 missing forecasts but revenue surging to $369 million, significantly surpassing expectations. Other analysts have offered varied ratings, including Market Outperform from JMP Securities and Oppenheimer, and Market Perform from BMO Capital.

feed.title: Hagerty director Kauffman sells $426k in shares
feed.summary: Robert I. Kauffman, a director at Hagerty, Inc. (NYSE:HGTY), sold 34,447 shares of Class A Common Stock for $426,453 on September 22, 2025. This transaction was part of a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. Despite the sale, Kauffman retains a substantial indirect and direct ownership in the company, which has shown strong market momentum and good financial health.

feed.title: Hagerty stock hits 52-week high at 12.99 USD
feed.summary: Hagerty Inc. (HGTY) stock reached a new 52-week high of $12.99, indicating strong market momentum and investor confidence, despite recently missing EPS expectations. The company reported robust revenue growth, and Oppenheimer initiated coverage with an "Outperform" rating, setting a $15.00 price target for the classic car niche specialist.

feed.title: Oppenheimer initiates Hagerty stock with Outperform rating on classic car niche
feed.summary: Oppenheimer initiated coverage on Hagerty Inc. (NYSE:HGTY) with an Outperform rating and a $15 price target, highlighting the company's specialized focus on classic cars and diverse revenue streams beyond traditional auto insurance. The firm emphasizes Hagerty's competitive moat and reduced exposure to typical insurance market cycles. This rating follows mixed Q2 2025 earnings, where Hagerty missed EPS forecasts but surpassed revenue expectations.

feed.title: Hagerty increases size of planned secondary stock sale
feed.summary: Hagerty has increased the size of its planned secondary stock sale to 9.7 million shares at $9.34 per share, aiming to raise approximately $86.5 million. The offering primarily facilitates the settlement of the estate of Kim Hagerty and involves members of the Hagerty family and Aldel LLC. This move comes as Hagerty expands its product offerings and maintains significant voting control among its major investors.

feed.title: Shareholders Will Probably Not Have Any Issues With Hagerty, Inc.'s (NYSE:HGTY) CEO Compensation
feed.summary: Hagerty, Inc. (NYSE:HGTY) shareholders are unlikely to object to CEO McKeel Hagerty's compensation, which at US$3.2m is 59% below the industry average for similar-sized companies. Despite a three-year shareholder loss of 18%, the company's EPS has grown by 66% over the same period, suggesting other factors are impacting share price performance. The upcoming AGM on June 3rd will allow shareholders to discuss company direction and executive remuneration alignment.

feed.title: Coco Champagne
feed.summary: Coco Champagne is the Chief Human Resources Officer & Administrative Officer at Hagerty, where she aligns strategy, operations, and core values. She oversees member sales and service, strategy planning, human resources, compensation, employee engagement, and growth culture, leveraging over a decade of experience with the company. Prior to Hagerty, she was an officer at a national bank and serves on the board of the Downtown Development Authority for Traverse City.

feed.title: Jay Koval
feed.summary: Jay Koval serves as the Senior Vice President of Investor Relations and Communications at Hagerty, joining in June 2022. He focuses on building relationships with investors, promoting Hagerty's growth strategy, and leading internal and external communications. Koval brings extensive experience from previous roles at Chobani, Brown-Forman, and Starwood Hotels and Resorts, where he significantly enhanced investor relations and company valuation.

feed.title: Motorlux Celebrates Its Third Year under Hagerty Ownership
feed.summary: Motorlux, the traditional kickoff event for Monterey Car Week, celebrated its third year under Hagerty ownership with an evening showcasing cars, airplanes, food, and drinks. The event featured a variety of luxury vehicles, private jets, and even a concurrently running Broad Arrow auction for high-value collector cars. Key highlights included a 1981 BMW M1 estimated at $470,000 to $570,000 and the McMurtry hypercar.

feed.title: The Patriot Was a High-Tech Chrysler Ahead of Its Time
feed.summary: This article details the ambitious but ultimately failed Chrysler Patriot project from the early 1990s, a turbine-electric hybrid sports racer intended for endurance racing. Despite its high-tech aspirations involving aerospace and defense contractors, the car never ran under its own power due to critical design flaws, particularly with its massive and volatile flywheel energy storage system. The project was eventually abandoned, and the Patriot name was later given to an entry-level Jeep.

feed.title: What’s in Car Insurance CEO McKeel Hagerty’s Own Collection?
feed.summary: McKeel Hagerty, CEO of the world’s largest classic vehicle insurance provider, shares details about his personal classic car collection, which began in his youth. The article highlights his early experiences with cars, including restoring a 1967 Porsche 911S, and details several notable vehicles in his current collection such as a 1966 Jaguar E-Type, a 1963 Split-Window Corvette, a 1965 Shelby Cobra, a 1955 Mercedes-Benz 300SL ‘Gullwing’ Coupe, a 1928 Bentley 4.5-liter, and a 1903 Knox. It also touches upon the Hagerty company's broader collection, including the Hagerty Learning Garage.

feed.title: What Happens When a Z-Car Obsessive Hands a Hot Rodder a Blank Check and a 240Z
feed.summary: This article details the transformation of a 1973 Datsun 240Z from a pristine Arizona survivor into a custom "factory GT" vehicle. A Z-Car enthusiast, Fran, enlisted the expertise of hot rodder Dean Cusano to reimagine the car with an open budget. The extensive modifications involved custom bodywork, suspension overhaul, engine upgrades, and bespoke wheels, resulting in a unique and refined version of the classic Z.

feed.title: 1962 Ferrari 250 GTO and 1947 Delahaye 135MS Narval Cabriolet Named Best in Show at The Amelia
feed.summary: The 29th annual Amelia Island Concours d’Elegance named a 1962 Ferrari 250 GTO as "Best in Show, Concours de Sport" and a 1947 Delahaye 135MS Narval Cabriolet as "Best in Show, Concours d’Elegance." The event, which saw over 27,000 enthusiasts attend, featured various automotive activities including an auction where a 1967 Ford GT40 Mk I Road Coupe sold for $4,405,000. McKeel Hagerty, Chairman of The Amelia, highlighted the event's 29 years of excellence and thanked attendees, participants, and sponsors.

feed.title: Hagerty Insurance Holdings reveals deal with Everspan Insurance Company
feed.summary: Hagerty, Inc. subsidiary Hagerty Insurance Holdings is acquiring all of the issued and outstanding capital stock of Consolidated National Insurance Company (CNIC) from Everspan Insurance Company for approximately US$18.4 million. This acquisition will allow Hagerty to incorporate a direct underwriting carrier model, reduce frictional costs, and expand its product offerings in the classic and enthusiast vehicle market. The deal for the Colorado-domiciled CNIC is expected to close in the second quarter.

feed.title: Life is imperfect. Why should our cars be any different?
feed.summary: This article explores the concept of "patina" in classic cars, advocating for the appreciation of age and wear over constant restoration. It discusses how the natural aging process of a car, marked by imperfections, tells a unique story and humanizes the machine, making it more interesting than a factory-new or fully restored vehicle. Experts and enthusiasts weigh in on why these signs of use should be celebrated rather than erased.

feed.title: Classic car lifestyle brand closed Dublin office after switch to remote work
feed.summary: Classic car lifestyle brand Hagerty has closed its Dublin office following a company-wide reevaluation of needs that found employees preferred flexibility over a physical office space. The office in Bridge Park had included an experience center with interactive classic car memorabilia and a driving simulator. This move comes after Hagerty had previously committed to Dublin for a regional office and planned to bring 200 jobs to the area.

feed.title: A new review of an old book that you may want in your library
feed.summary: Rob Siegel reviews Dick O’Kane's 1968 book, "How To Repair Your Foreign Car," sharing his personal connection to automotive literature and highlighting the book's enduring charm and humor. Siegel contrasts O'Kane's practical, entertaining guide with other influential automotive books, praising its common-sense approach to troubleshooting vintage cars despite some outdated advice. He recommends the book for enthusiasts of simple old cars and good writing.

feed.title: How a Midwestern Insurance Salesman Cornered the Classic Car Market
feed.summary: McKeel Hagerty has transformed his family's classic car insurance business into a conglomerate that aims to control every aspect of the collectible car universe. This expansion includes acquiring major car events, storage clubs, tech companies, and auction houses, raising questions about potential conflicts of interest and the impact on the diverse classic car culture. While Hagerty believes this consolidation is necessary to preserve classic car culture, critics express concerns about the company's market dominance and data access.

feed.title: Check Out Hagerty Cars & Caffeine—The Day Before The Amelia
feed.summary: This article showcases the Hagerty Cars & Caffeine event, held the day before The Amelia, offering a more accessible car show experience than the main Concours. It highlights a variety of vehicles, from classic BMWs and Cadillacs to Porsches, Lamborghinis, and custom builds, emphasizing the diverse range of cars and passionate owners present. The author shares personal favorites and memorable encounters from the 2023 event.

feed.title: Greenwich Concours Adds Concours de Sport Saturday, Honors Wayne Carini as Grand Marshal
feed.summary: Hagerty announced that the Greenwich Concours will return to a two-day competitive format, adding a Concours de Sport focusing on motorsports and performance cars to its weekend programming on Saturday, June 3rd. TV host Wayne Carini will serve as Grand Marshal for the 2023 event, which also includes the traditional Concours d'Elegance on Sunday, June 4th. The event aims to celebrate automotive culture and attract new enthusiasts with fan-favorite activities and special car classes.

feed.title: No ’80s RV broke the mold like EMC’s Starfire
feed.summary: This article delves into the unique history of the ElDorado Motor Corporation's (EMC) Starfire RV, an innovative vehicle from the 1980s. Through an interview with former EMC employee Dennis Foerschler, the piece explores the Starfire's advanced design, manufacturing process, and technological features that set it apart from its contemporaries, even detailing its eventual downfall despite widespread innovation. The article also touches on EMC's company history, its challenges in the RV market, and a brief reflection on the modern #vanlife trend.

feed.title: 1932 Duesenberg wins Pebble Beach Concours Best of Show
feed.summary: A 1932 Duesenberg J Figoni Sports Torpedo, owned by Lee and Penny Anderson, won the Best in Show award at the 71st Pebble Beach Concours d’Elegance. This marks the seventh Duesenberg to win the prestigious award, following a three-year restoration and the reunion of its original chassis and body. The competition this year featured a diverse range of vehicles and intense rivalry among participants.

feed.title: Class of ’22: Bugatti EB110
feed.summary: The Bugatti EB110, launched in 1991, is highlighted as a technological marvel from the early 1990s, often overshadowed by the McLaren F1. This article details its V12 quad-turbocharged engine, impressive performance, and luxurious interior. It also notes a recent surge in market value, with prices exceeding $2M in 2022, indicating its growing recognition three decades after its release.

feed.title: 8 Greenwich winners you may have missed
feed.summary: This article highlights eight notable vehicles and their owners from the 26th annual Greenwich Concours d'Elegance, along with events like Cars & Community, Concours d’Lemons, and Radwood. It details various winning cars, trucks, and motorcycles, showcasing their unique features and histories. The piece emphasizes the intimate and diverse nature of the Greenwich event compared to larger concours.
